prior_works.title: YCB Object and Model Set: Towards Common Benchmarks for Manipulation Research
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Provided metrically accurate object meshes with real-world scale and physical attributes (e.g., mass), directly motivating PhysX-3D’s absolute-scale annotation and physics-grounded asset specification.

prior_works.title: PartNet-Mobility: A Large-Scale Database for Articulated Objects
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Established standardized kinematic annotations (joint types, motion axes) for 3D objects, informing PhysX-3D’s kinematics dimension and the representation of object mobility in assets.

prior_works.title: SAPIEN: A Simulated Part-based Interactive Environment
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrated the importance of physics-rich, interaction-centric simulation with articulated assets, shaping PhysX-3D’s emphasis on simulation-ready 3D models with physical parameters.

prior_works.title: ObjectFolder 2.0: A Multisensory, Multimodal Dataset of Household Objects for Robotics
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Introduced objects with physically meaningful parameters across modalities (acoustics, thermal, tactile), directly inspiring PhysX-3D’s material and function-oriented annotations for physical reasoning.

prior_works.title: Objaverse: A Universe of Annotated 3D Objects
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Served as a large-scale source of textured assets widely used in 3D generative training, while highlighting the community gap in physics/affordance/scale labels that PhysX-3D systematically addresses.

prior_works.title: DreamFusion: Text-to-3D using 2D Diffusion
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Pioneered score-distillation-based text-to-3D generation that PhysX-3D can extend by conditioning or constraining generation with physical annotations to yield simulation-ready assets.

prior_works.title: GAPartNet: Cross-Category Domain-Generalizable Articulated Part Segmentation and Manipulation
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Provided part-level affordance and manipulation cues over PartNet objects, informing PhysX-3D’s affordance dimension and its linkage between geometry, parts, and functional use.

synthesis_narrative: PhysX-3D’s central contribution—physical-grounded 3D asset generation with standardized annotations across absolute scale, material, affordance, kinematics, and function—sits at the intersection of 3D generative modeling and physics-rich robotics datasets/simulators. On the generation side, DreamFusion established score distillation as a practical path from language to 3D, yet its outputs (like most follow-ups) prioritize geometry and appearance over physical usability. Objaverse catalyzed large-scale 3D training but lacks consistent physics, scale, and affordance labels, exposing an infrastructural gap that PhysX-3D directly targets. On the robotics/physics side, YCB introduced metrically accurate, physically characterized objects, motivating PhysX-3D’s absolute-scale requirement for real-world deployment. PartNet-Mobility standardized kinematic structure (joint types and motion axes) for articulated objects, which maps naturally to PhysX-3D’s kinematics dimension. GAPartNet further linked object parts to manipulation affordances, guiding PhysX-3D’s affordance design that couples geometry with actionable function. Complementing these, SAPIEN showed that physics-centric simulation demands assets with articulated structure and material parameters, while ObjectFolder 2.0 demonstrated the value of multi-sensory, physically meaningful object attributes beyond appearance. Together, these works directly inform PhysX-3D’s dataset schema and its end-to-end paradigm: retain modern 3D generative capacity, but constrain and annotate assets so they are metrically scaled, materially plausible, functionally annotated, and kinematically operable—thereby transforming text/conditioned generation into simulation- and embodiment-ready 3D asset creation.
